page.title: 05HOUSING IN PENSBY
page.content: Prior to the 1920's Pensby was mainly farmland and open fields, i.e. a rural area. There was a "housing explosion" in the late 1920's and 1930's. The population rose, resulting in the need for a new school. Pensby County Primary School was built in 1936. There was a further "housing explosion" in the 1960's. The 1936 school was not large enough so the Juniors stayed in the old building and a new Infant School was build in 1964. Pensby is now mainly a built up suburban area. Houses in Pensby are mainly three bedroomed, semi-detached, two storey buildings with gardens and a garage. Heating is mainly by gas. Houses are mainly owner occupied. The majority of houses built before the 1960's have been extended or modernised.
